lead_paragraph: On Oct. 21, 1879, Thomas Edison devised a workable electric light at his laboratory in Menlo Park, N.J. A New York Times reporter visited Edison there and wrote an article about it that appeared in the paper on Dec. 28, 1879. "The lamp which Mr. Edison regards as a crowning triumph is a model of simplicity and economy," he said.

headline.main: Oct. 21, 1879 | Thomas Edison Lights the Lamp
